ovdesc.p: This application is used to load details of the CRF reports that are to be printed in the batch run.
It is also used to run CRF reports on-line as at the close of business on the previous working day.
The functions (I)nput, (C)opy, (L)ist, (P)rint, (R)eversal, S(ee) and V(erify) are available.
The (I)nput and (C)opy functions are used to load the records to the file.
The V(erify) function is used to produce the reports during the on-line day.
For the reports to be produced as part of the batch run the key of the appropriate record is to entered into the Data field of the EB.STAT.PRINT batch record.

desc.p: The name of any alternative print routine required should be entered here.
The routine named here will be used in place of the standard routine to produce output from this application.
Up to 32 Alphanumeric characters (Optional input)
The named routine must exist on the PGM.FILE.
The PGM.FILE record must be set up as a type 'S' (Subroutine).
Specify the date of the Post Closing period where reports are to be produced from
Must be a valid date
Is the name of the report to be produced as held on the RE.STAT.REPORT.HEAD file.
3-21 alphanumeric characters. Multivalue associated with fields 4 & 5. Mandatory Input.
Must be the key to a record on the RE.STAT.REPORT.HEAD file.
For each multivalue occurrence there must be data in this field and Field 4.1 contents.
The type or format of output required.
This field is used to request either the standard printed output or an alternative disk file output format.
The word 'PRINT' indicates that the report is to be printed.

Any other value in this field indicates that the report output is to be re-directed to a sequential disk file. In this case, the value must identify a record on the CRF report extract file (RE STAT OUTPUT), where the layout and content of the output file is defined.
Both printed output and extraction to disk may be specified for the same report. However, multiple extract file formats cannot be requested.
The default value is 'PRINT'.
Up to 12 type 'A' (alphanumeric characters). Mandatory Input Multivalue Associated with fields 4 & 5.
A maximum of two sub-values are allowed.
Duplicate sub-values are not permitted.
If the value is not 'PRINT', it must identify a record on the CRF extract format file (RE STAT OUTPUT).
Only one extract format may be specified per report.
Indicates which language is to be used for printing the report.
If left blank, the report language defaults to the user language.
Up to 2 numeric characters (01 to 12). Optional input.
Must be a valid language code.
Identifies the currency in which the report is to be produced if not local currency.

When a report or series of reports is required in a currency other than the local currency, then this field contains the currency of the report and must also be the key of a record on the RE.BASE.CCY.PARAM file. See the applications RE.BASE.CCY.PARAM and RE.BASE.CCY.REQ for the setting of these two files prior to producing reports in different currencies.
3 alphbetic characters type 'CCY'. Optional Input
Must be a valid record on the RE.BASE.CCY.PARAM file.
Indicates what level of report is required.

Valid Value are: SUMMARY - prints only the specified report lines DETAIL -prints specified report lines and the indiviual consolidation records that make up each line. BOTH - produce a summary and then a Detail report. Mandatory Input Mutivalue Associated with fields 3 & 5.
The data entered must be SUMMARY, DETAIL or BOTH.
For each multivalue occurence there must be data in this field and field 3.1 Report Name.
Used for free format notes.
This field is provided for entering notes and is not used anywhere else.
Up to 35 alphanumeric characters. Multivalue field. (Optional Input)
Identifies the different records on this file.
The key of the record used for the end of day reports is to be loaded into the Data field in the Batch record for EB.STAT.PRINT.
1-14 SWIFT characters. Mandatory Input.
